subject: Web3
title: Contributor Burnout
description: Learn Contributor Burnout in one minute.

hook.text: DAO contributors work across time zones, handle constant governance drama, and often go unpaid for months.

buildup.text: Early DAO contributors were motivated by mission and token incentives. Many expected the tokens to make them rich.

discovery.text: When token prices crashed, compensation lost value. Contributors who were paid in tokens saw their earnings evaporate.

twist.text: Without HR departments, health insurance, or job security, DAO work is precarious. There's no safety net.

climax.text: Many passionate contributors left DAOs burned out. Sustainable contributor models are still being figured out.

punchline.text: No boss also means no benefits, no stability, and no HR.

quiz.question: Why do DAO contributors often experience burnout?
options: No job security, volatile compensation, and constant governance overhead
